option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"D:/pycharm/APIYT-Project":"{\"/app/router/user.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`create_user`: This function creates a new user in the database and returns the created user.\\n\\n`get_user`: This function retrieves a user from the database based on the provided ID, and returns the user if found, otherwise raises a 404 Not Found exception.\\n\\nThe file also imports several modules and defines an APIRouter with the prefix \\\"/users\\\" and the tag \\\"Users\\\". The file appears to be part of a FastAPI application that handles user-related operations.\",\"/app/router/__init__.py\":\"There are no classes or functions in the provided file. The file appears to be an empty XML document with a `\\u003cdocument\\u003e` tag, but no content within it.\",\"/app/database.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`startup()`: This function establishes a connection to a PostgreSQL database and creates a cursor object, retrying the connection if it fails.\\n\\n`shutdown()`: This function closes the database connection and cursor.\\n\\nThe file is responsible for managing the connection to a PostgreSQL database, providing a way to connect to the database and close the connection when necessary.\",\"/app/config.py\":\"This file defines a Pydantic `BaseSettings` class called `Settings` that loads environment variables from a `.env` file and provides access to those variables as attributes of the class.\\n\\n`Settings`: A Pydantic class that loads environment variables from a `.env` file and provides access to those variables as attributes.\",\"/app/oauth2.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`create_access_token`: Generates a JWT token with the user\\u0027s data and a specified expiration time.\\n\\n`verify_token`: Verifies the validity of a JWT token and extracts the user\\u0027s ID from the token.\\n\\n`get_current_user`: Retrieves the current user\\u0027s information from the database based on the provided JWT token.\\n\\nThis file is responsible for handling authentication and authorization using JWT tokens in a FastAPI application.\",\"/app/__init__.py\":\"There are no classes or functions in the provided file. The file appears to be an empty XML document with a `\\u003cdocument\\u003e` tag, but no content within it.\",\"/app/router/vote.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`vote`: This function handles the voting functionality for a post, allowing users to vote or remove their vote on a post.\\n\\nThe file appears to be an API router for handling voting-related operations in a web application. It uses the FastAPI framework and interacts with a database to store and retrieve voting information.\",\"/app/main.py\":\"This file is the main entry point for a FastAPI application. It sets up the FastAPI application, includes the routers for the different endpoints (post, user, and auth), and defines two event handlers for startup and shutdown of the application.\\n\\n`FastAPI`: A web framework for building APIs with Python.\\n\\n`startup()`: Initializes the database connection when the application starts up.\\n\\n`shutdown()`: Closes the database connection when the application shuts down.\",\"/app/router/auth.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`login`: This function authenticates a user by checking their email and password, and returns a token if the credentials are valid.\\n\\nThe file appears to be an API router for handling authentication-related functionality in a FastAPI application. It includes a single endpoint `/login` that takes in a username and password, verifies the user\\u0027s credentials, and returns a token if the authentication is successful.\",\"/app/router/post.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`get_posts`: Retrieves a list of posts from the database, with an optional limit on the number of posts returned.\\n\\n`create_posts`: Creates a new post in the database.\\n\\n`get_post`: Retrieves a specific post from the database by its ID.\\n\\n`delete_post`: Deletes a specific post from the database by its ID.\\n\\n`update`: Updates a specific post in the database by its ID.\\n\\nThis file is part of a FastAPI application that provides an API for managing blog posts. It defines the routes and functions for handling CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations on blog posts.\",\"/app/schema.py\":\"This file defines several Pydantic models for a web application:\\n\\n`Post`: A model for a blog post, with fields for title, content, and published status.\\n`PostCreate`: A model for creating a new post, inheriting from `Post`.\\n`PostResponse`: A model for returning a post, with additional fields for ID, creation time, and user ID.\\n`UserCreate`: A model for creating a new user, with fields for email and password.\\n`UserOut`: A model for returning user information, with fields for ID and email.\\n`UserLogin`: A model for user login, with fields for email and password.\\n`Token`: A model for an authentication token, with fields for the token and token type.\\n`TokenData`: A model for token data, with an optional ID field.\\n`Vote`: A model for a user\\u0027s vote on a post, with fields for the post ID and the direction of the vote (0 or 1).\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions, but rather defines the data models used throughout the application.\",\"/app/utils.py\":\"This file does not contain any classes. It contains the following functions:\\n\\n`hash`: This function takes a password as input and returns the hashed version of the password using the bcrypt algorithm.\\n\\n`verify`: This function takes a plain password and a hashed password as input, and returns `True` if the plain password matches the hashed password, and `False` otherwise.\\n\\nThe file also initializes a `CryptContext` object from the `passlib.context` module, which is used to manage the hashing and verification of passwords.\"}"}
